alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin, southeastern Johnson, northern Floyd, northwestern Pike and east central Magoffin Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Job to Davella to Allen. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Inez, Forest Hills, Warfield, Allen, Meta, Pilgrim, Oaklawn Estates, Davella, Lancer, Whitehouse, Piso, Collista, West Van Lear, West Royalton Station, Williamsport, Blue River, Milo and Jarad. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 9. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 12 and 14. U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 9 and 17, and near mile marker 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 7 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
